option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/kosty/AndroidStudioProjects/Clone_MusicPlayer_QF":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/carsyso/mediasdk/core/MediaService.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `MediaService`, which is a service that runs in the background and manages media-related tasks. Here\\u0027s a summary of the class and its functions:\\n\\n`MediaService`: A service that runs in the background and manages media-related tasks, such as creating a silent notification to keep the service running in the foreground.\\n\\n`onCreate()`: Initializes the service by creating a notification channel and a silent notification, and then starts the service in the foreground.\\n\\n`onStartCommand(intent: Intent?, flags: Int, startId: Int)`: Handles the start command for the service, returning `START_STICKY` to ensure the service is restarted if it is killed.\\n\\n`onDestroy()`: Handles the destruction of the service.\\n\\n`onBind(intent: Intent?)`: Returns `null` as this service does not support binding.\\n\\n`createNotificationChannel()`: Creates a notification channel for the service, if the device is running Android 8.0 (Oreo) or higher.\\n\\n`createSilentNotification()`: Creates a silent notification for the service, which is used to keep the service running in the foreground.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but instead, it sets up the necessary plugins for the project, including the Android application plugin, the Kotlin Android plugin, and the Kotlin Compose plugin.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a centralized location for defining common build settings and dependencies that can be shared across all the sub-projects or modules in the Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/qf/media/base/BaseApplication.kt\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`BaseApplication`: This class extends the `Application` class and is used as the base application for the project, where any necessary initialization or setup can be performed.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather it overrides the `onCreate()` method of the `Application` class, which is called when the application is first created. This method is used to perform any necessary initialization or setup for the application.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up a base application class that can be used as a starting point for the project, allowing for any necessary initialization or setup to be performed when the application is first created.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, dependencies, and build settings for the application. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, it configures the Android build process using the Gradle build system.\\n\\nThe key elements in this file are:\\n\\n`plugins`: Specifies the Android application and Kotlin plugins to be used in the project.\\n`android`: Configures the Android-specific settings, such as the namespace, compile SDK version, default app settings, and build types.\\n`dependencies`: Specifies the external libraries and dependencies to be included in the project, such as Android Core KTX, Lifecycle, Compose, and testing frameworks.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up the necessary configuration and dependencies for building an Android application using Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/qf/musicplayer/ui/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `MainActivity`, which is responsible for launching a mapped player application and starting a `MediaService`. Here\\u0027s a summary of the class and its functions:\\n\\n`MainActivity`: This class is the main activity of the application and is responsible for handling the launch of a mapped player application and starting a `MediaService`.\\n\\n`onCreate`: This function is called when the activity is created. It checks if the activity is the root task, retrieves the mapped player package from shared preferences, and launches the mapped player application\\u0027s main activity. If the mapping is not found, it starts the `SettingActivity`. It also starts the `MediaService`.\\n\\n`onDestroy`: This function is called when the activity is destroyed, and it logs a message indicating that the `MainActivity` has been destroyed.\\n\\n`MODE_PRIVATE`: This is a constant that represents the mode for accessing shared preferences in a private context.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/carsyso/mediasdk/core/MappingHelper.kt\":\"This file contains a `MappingHelper` class and several utility functions related to finding and mapping media-related activities and services in Android applications.\\n\\n`MappingHelper`: A class that provides methods for finding the package name and recommended activities/services for a given media player name or package name.\\n\\n`getPackageNameForPlayer`: Finds the package name for a given media player name.\\n`getActivitiesForPackage`: Returns a list of activity names for a given package name.\\n`getServicesForPackage`: Returns a list of service names for a given package name.\\n`findRecommendedMainActivity`: Finds the recommended main activity for a given package name.\\n`findRecommendedPcmPlayerActivity`: Finds the recommended PCM player activity for a given package name.\\n`findRecommendedMediaService`: Finds the recommended media service for a given package name.\\n`findActivityByIntent`: Finds an activity by a given intent action and MIME type.\\n`findServiceByIntent`: Finds a service by a given intent action.\\n`findBestMatch`: Finds the best match from a list of items based on a prioritized map of keyword combinations.\\n`getMainActivityName`: Retrieves the main activity name for a given package name.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/qf/musicplayer/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file is a unit test class for the `com.qf.musicplayer` package. It contains a single test function that checks if the addition operation `2 + 2` is correct.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A class that contains unit tests for the `com.qf.musicplayer` package.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that verifies that the addition operation `2 + 2` is correct.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/carsyso/mediasdk/core/AppPreferences.kt\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions:\\n\\n`AppPreferences`: A class that provides methods for saving and retrieving recommended components (main activity, PCM player activity, and media service) for a given package name in the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\n`saveRecommendedComponents`: Saves the recommended components for a given package name in the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n`getRecommendedComponents`: Retrieves the recommended components for a given package name from the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n`getRecommendedMainActivity`: Retrieves the recommended main activity for a given package name from the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n`getRecommendedPcmPlayerActivity`: Retrieves the recommended PCM player activity for a given package name from the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n`getRecommendedMediaService`: Retrieves the recommended media service for a given package name from the app\\u0027s shared preferences.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/carsyso/mediasdk/core/SettingActivity.kt\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `SettingActivity` class, which is responsible for managing the settings and mapping of media players in the application.\\n\\n`SettingActivity`: This class is responsible for displaying the list of available media players, allowing the user to select a player, and configuring the mapping of the selected player to the application\\u0027s components.\\n\\n`findMediaPlayers()`: This function retrieves the list of installed media players on the device and populates the list view.\\n\\n`showAllApps()`: This function displays the list of all installed applications on the device, allowing the user to select a player from the full list.\\n\\n`showMappingInterface()`: This function displays the interface for mapping the selected media player to the application\\u0027s components, including the main activity, PCM player activity, and media service.\\n\\n`saveMapping()`: This function saves the mapping of the selected media player to the application\\u0027s components.\\n\\n`getPackageNameForPlayer(playerName: String?)`: This function retrieves the package name for the selected media player.\\n\\n`showHelpDialog(messageResId: Int)`: This function displays a help dialog with the provided message.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/qf/musicplayer/ui/PcmPlayerActivity.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `PcmPlayerActivity`, which is an Android `Activity` that is responsible for launching a mapped player activity based on the saved preferences.\\n\\n`PcmPlayerActivity`: An Android `Activity` that launches a mapped player activity based on the saved preferences.\\n\\n`onCreate`: Initializes the `AppPreferences` object, retrieves the mapped player package name from the shared preferences, and checks if the mapping is saved before launching the activity.\\n\\n`onDestroy`: Logs a message when the `PcmPlayerActivity` is destroyed.\\n\\n`MODE_PRIVATE`: A constant that represents the mode for accessing private shared preferences.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/qf/musicplayer/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app called \\\"MusicPlayer\\\". It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and tests the app\\u0027s context.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test function checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value, which is \\\"com.qf.musicplayer\\\".\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file for an Android project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the project\\u0027s build settings and dependencies.\\n\\nThe `pluginManagement` block specifies the repositories to be used for resolving Gradle plugins, including the Google Maven repository, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\nThe `dependencyResolutionManagement` block configures the repositories to be used for resolving project dependencies, including the Google Maven repository and Maven Central.\\n\\nThe `rootProject.name` line sets the name of the root project to \\\"Clone_MusicPlayer_QF\\\".\\n\\nThe `include(\\\":app\\\")` line includes the \\\":app\\\" module in the project.\"}"}
